definitions: Past tense and past participle of lend.
To give something to someone for a period of time, expecting that it will be given back.
To allow the use of a sum of money for a period of time, usually in return for interest.
To contribute or impart a quality to.
examples: The bank lent him a large sum.
The dark clouds lent a somber mood to the scene.
He lent his support to the project.
